item.title: Distributions in R and Julia
item.description: Some Comparisons I was reviewing the basics using RCall R"rnorm(10)" RObject{RealSxp} [1] 0.06413084 -0.51964398 0.82969290 0.68962573 0.00304495 -0.4673550 6 [7] -2.64695879 0.44629186 0.40299374 -1.13655719 Here is a breakdown comparing the main distribution functions in R to Julia. Description R Julia Density dnorm pdf Distribution Function pnorm cdf Quantile Function qnorm quantile Random Generation rnorm rand In the table above I used just one of the distributions (the Normal) for comparison.
